org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode

Class DirectoryScanner.ScanInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.DirectoryScanner.ScanInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<DirectoryScanner.ScanInfo>
    Enclosing class:
    DirectoryScanner

    static class DirectoryScanner.ScanInfo
extends Object
implements Comparable<DirectoryScanner.ScanInfo>
    Tracks the files and other information related to a block on the disk Missing file is indicated by setting the corresponding member to null. Because millions of these structures may be created, we try to save memory here. So instead of storing full paths, we store path suffixes. The block file, if it exists, will have a path like this: / So we don't need to store the volume path, since we already know what the volume is. The metadata file, if it exists, will have a path like this: /_.meta So if we have a block file, there isn't any need to store the block path again. The accessor functions take care of these manipulations.

    • Field Detail

      • blockId

        private final long blockId

      • blockSuffix

        private final String blockSuffix
        The block file path, relative to the volume's base directory. If there was no block file found, this may be null. If 'vol' is null, then this is the full path of the block file.

      • metaSuffix

        private final String metaSuffix
        The suffix of the meta file path relative to the block file. If blockSuffix is null, then this will be the entire path relative to the volume base directory, or an absolute path if vol is also null.

      • volume

        private final FsVolumeSpi volume

      • blockFileLength

        private final long blockFileLength
        Get the file's length in async block scan

    • Method Detail

      • getCondensedPath

        private static String getCondensedPath(String path)
        Get the most condensed version of the path. For example, the condensed version of /foo//bar is /foo/bar Unlike File.getCanonicalPath(), this will never perform I/O on the filesystem.

      • getSuffix

        private static String getSuffix(File f,
               String prefix)
        Get a path suffix.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to get the suffix for.
        prefix - The prefix we're stripping off.
        Returns:
        A suffix such that prefix + suffix = path to f
